summary: This document contains excerpts from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition on April 22, 2016, and July 22, 2016, in a civil case. Maxwell is questioned about her knowledge of underage girls at Jeffrey Epstein's properties, her role in inviting or recruiting them, and her awareness of sexual activities and paraphernalia. She repeatedly denies knowledge or involvement, with her attorney objecting frequently.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual being deposed. She is questioned extensively about her knowledge of underage girls at Jeffrey Epstein's properties, her role in inviting them, and her awareness of sexual activities. She denies knowledge or involvement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the deposition. Questions revolve around his homes, his recruitment of underage masseuses, and his sexual activities. Maxwell describes him as a friend.

persons.name: Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who repeatedly objects to the form and foundation of questions during her deposition.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referred to as 'Jane Doe #3' or 'Virginia' in the context of questions about her age when Maxwell met her and whether she was a masseuse. Maxwell claims uncertainty about her age and disputes her claims.

connections.description: Maxwell was present at Epstein's homes and questions focus on her role in his activities. She describes him as a friend and admits to having three-way sexual activities with him on occasion.
Pagliuca acts as Maxwell's defense attorney during the deposition, frequently objecting to questions posed to her.
Maxwell claims she met Giuffre through Epstein and Giuffre's mother, but professes no memory of how old Giuffre was when they met.
Giuffre is referenced as an alleged underage masseuse for Epstein, with Maxwell disputing the claims about her age and role.

events.title: Maxwell Deposition - Underage Girls Inquiry
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is deposed and questioned extensively about whether she invited underage females to Jeffrey Epstein's homes and her awareness of underage masseuses.

events.title: Maxwell Deposition - Sexual Activities Inquiry
events.description: Follow-up deposition where Maxwell is questioned about her knowledge of sex toys at Epstein's properties and whether she recruited people for sexual activities with Epstein.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's property in the Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell testified under oath that she was not aware of inviting any underage females, other than children of her friends, to Jeffrey Epstein's homes.
Maxwell stated she was not aware of any teenagers working as masseuses in Epstein's home during the time she was present, claiming all masseuses were adults over 18.
When asked about Virginia Giuffre, Maxwell claimed she had 'no idea' how old Giuffre was when they met and disputed Giuffre's claims about her age, suggesting she had 'changed her age so many times.'
Maxwell denied knowledge of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages, stating 'I don't know what you are talking about.'
In a later deposition, Maxwell denied being aware of sex toys or devices used in sexual activities at any of Epstein's properties and denied ever recruiting anyone for sexual activities with Epstein.
